text: im running into a stackoverflow when comparing (`==`) in-place solves with non-inplace sols, bug or intended? stack and MWE in reply.

elements.text: im running into a stackoverflow when comparing (
) in-place solves with non-inplace sols, bug or intended? stack and MWE in reply.

text:
```# ==(::sol, ::sol) stackoverflow MWE
using DifferentialEquations

A = [2 -5; 1 -2]

function f(u, p, t)
  A*u
end

function f2!(du, u, p, t) 
  du .= A*u
end

u0 = [1, 1]
tspan = (0., 10.)

prob = ODEProblem(f2!, u0, tspan, [])
sol = solve(prob)

prob2 = ODEProblem(f, u0, tspan, [])
sol2 = solve(prob2)

sol == sol2

julia> sol == sol2
ERROR: StackOverflowError:

text: <https://github.com/SciML/DifferentialEquations.jl/issues/719|kk>. i think it is, because it works if both are inplace or both aren't inplace

elements.text: . i think it is, because it works if both are inplace or both aren't inplace
